text: Jamil Tutunji (1896–1981) was a Jordanian doctor and politician who served as Minister of Health and Ambassador to the Soviet Union. == Career== In 1918, Tutunji was a Medical Officer in the Ottoman Army. From 1919 to 1922, he practiced as a Physician in the Madeba District. In 1923, he entered the Arab Legion. From 1923 to 1940, he was the Royal Physician. From 1940 to 1950,Tutunji was the Director of Health. From 1950 to 1951, he was the Deputy Minister of Health. From 1951 to 1962, he was the Minister of Health and Social Affairs. From 1962 to 1963, he was appointed as a member of the Senate. On 30 March 1964 to 1965, Tutunji was appointed as Jordan's first ambassador to the Soviet Union in Moscow, serving until 1965. From 1967 to 1971, he was appointed as a member of the Senate. ==Awards and honours== *Order of the Star of Jordan *Knight of the Order of Saint John (chartered 1888) *Knight of the Order of the Holy Sepulchre *Decoration of Revolution and of Independence ==References== Category:1896 births Category:1981 deaths Category:Health ministers of Jordan Category:Ambassadors of Jordan to Russia Category:Members of the Senate of Jordan
title: Jamil Tutunji
